intro: Murdannia nimmoniana var. sahyadrica, commonly known as the Sahyadri murdannia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
